Body:
I have a raspberry pi that sends messages to the azure iot hub and stores the messages in a storage container. The problem now is that inside my blob container i have the following folder structure: 'name of iot hub'/01/year/month/day/random number?/blobfiles I dont know where this structure is comming from. It got generated automatically it seems. Inside the blobs are my messages which is fine but the folder structure is weird. Is there a way to delete all these unwanted folders? Deleting them wont help because with the next message they just come back.

Anyway i wanted to create a logic function with trigger when a blob is modified or added and selected the right storage container but the trigger never activates. why is this the case ? A http request for example works. But the blob trigger isnt.

Greetings, Julian

First, check your storage account and make sure it is a general-purpose storage account not Blob-only storage account. Because

Blob-only storage accounts are supported for blob input and output bindings but not for blob triggers. Blob storage triggers require a general-purpose storage account.

Ref: Azure Blob storage bindings for Azure Functions

I show my settings here as a reference for you to check yours.

My Storage account is general purpose v1. You can check yours at storage account Overview-> Account kind.

My blob container name is "blobcontainer" and my function.json is

{	  "bindings": [	    {	      "name": "myBlob"
column13:
"disabled": false }

Here you need check the "AzureWebJobsDashboard" to see if has the right storage account name and key in function application settings like this:

My run.csx is

public static void Run([BlobTrigger("blobcontainer/{name}")] Stream myBlob
column15:
TraceWriter log) { log.Info($"C# Blob trigger function Processed blob\n Name:{name} \n Size: {myBlob.Length} Bytes"); }

Start the function when the blob has file created you will see the following log:

As for the folder structure
column16:
it is determined by the storage endpoint created in Azure IoT Hub like this:

In order
column17: they are your IoT Hub name

Body: Hey thanks for your answer. I checked my container and it is general purpose v1.	But i think you are talking about a Function App. I am talking about a logic function. I dont know where to find your mentioned json file or run.csx
@J.Biedenbach Well, what do you mean logic function"? Is [Logic Apps](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/logic-apps/)?"
